title: Job Vacancies at Sterling Health HMO
content:
Sterling Health HMO is  a National Health Insurance Agency (NHIA)-accredited Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) that has been providing 24/7/365 quality affordable healthcare service to the public and private sector nationally since 2007.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Chartered Accountant, ACA

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type:Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	iCAN certified. First Degree / HND Accounts
	HMO experience is an advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: sterlinghmo@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted applica will be contacted 

 

 

2.) ICT Officer / Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type:Full-time

Responsibilities


	Develop and implement all IT policies and procedures, including those for architecture, security, disaster recovery, standards, service provision and archives
	System Administrator 
	Experience in a similar setting is an advantage 


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: sterlinghmo@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Accounts Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type:Full-time

Requirements


	HND / BSc Accounts. 
	Audit experience or in a similar setting is an advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: sterlinghmo@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Account / Admin Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	The Account/Admin Officer will be responsible for handling the company’s day-to-day accounting functions while providing administrative support to ensure smooth office operations.
	The role requires accuracy, confidentiality, and strong organizational skills in managing financial records, payments, and administrative tasks.


Key Responsibilities
Accounting Responsibilities:


	Maintain accurate financial records and accounting books
	Prepare and process invoices, receipts, and payment vouchers
	Handle daily cash, bank transactions, and reconciliations
	Monitor accounts payable and accounts receivable
	Prepare basic financial reports (income, expenses, cash flow)
	Support payroll preparation and staff expense reimbursements
	Ensure proper documentation and filing of financial records
	Assist in budgeting and financial planning activities
	Support statutory compliance (tax, pension, PAYE, etc.)


Administrative Responsibilities:


	Manage office documentation, records, and correspondence
	Provide general administrative support to management and staff
	Coordinate office supplies and ensure smooth daily operations
	Schedule meetings, appointments, and maintain calendars
	Assist with staff onboarding documentation and record keeping
	Handle internal and external communications professionally


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of financial records
	Compliance with accounting and administrative procedures
	Timely processing of payments and invoices
	Efficiency of office operations and documentation
	Quality of administrative support provided

	HND or Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field
	Professional certifications (ICAN, ACCA – in view or completed) are an added advantage

	Minimum of 1–3 years of experience in an accounting or administrative role
	Experience working in an SME, training institute, or service-based organization is an advantage

	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and accounting software

	Honest, reliable, and detail-oriented

Job type: Full-time

	The Receptionist will be the first point of contact for visitors and callers, providing a warm, professional, and efficient front-desk experience.

	Maintain a pleasant and professional atmosphere in the waiting area by keeping noise levels low and guiding guests to avoid unnecessary conversations.


Qualifications & Experience


	OND / HND / Degree in any field preferred
	Previous experience in a receptionist, front desk, or administrative role is an advantage
	Fluency in spoken and written English (or relevant language) is required
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)


Key Skills & Attributes:


	Excellent verbal communication skills with clear and confident speech

	Strong interpersonal and customer service skills

	Attention to detail

	Punctual, reliable, and well-presented.

	Review and process reimbursements

	Implement energy-saving and sustainability initiatives.
	Prepare, track, and reconcile ledgers and budgets
	Create financial and inventory reports
	Identify and correct miscalculations and financial discrepancies
	Run and update accounting databases
	Develop and streamline operational efficiencies.

	Prompt processing and payment of all office and apartments utility/domestic bills (Dstv, Internet, phone bills, Waste disposal, phcn, diesel, fuel etc), including subscriptions update and computer upgrades.

	Coordinate meeting within EBS, procuring needed stationery supplies, Printing portfolios and materials for presentations

	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
